isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ENGINE COOLING SYSTEM - CLEAN AND INSPECT - RADIATOR COMPONENTS

svcsubproc.title: Radiator Tanks
svcsubproc.para: Look for leaks, particularly where the tubes join the headers. Vibration, and heating and cooling cycles can fatigue soldered seams.

svcsubproc.title: Tubes (Core)
svcsubproc.para: Because the radiator tubes are very small, they can become clogged or partially blocked by rust and scale. The general condition of the cooling system and the operating temperature level are indications of the state of cleanliness of the tubes.

svcsubproc.title: Fins
svcsubproc.para: These thin metal sheets radiate, or pass off, the heat picked up from the circulating coolant by the tubes. Keep the fins free of bugs, leaves, straw and other interference to allow free passage of air. Straighten bent fins for maximum efficiency.
